definitions.definition: to get or receive something from someone with the intention of giving it back after a period of time:
examples: I had to borrow a pen from the invigilator to do the exam.

definitions.definition: to take money from a bank or other financial organization and pay it back over a period of time:
examples: Like so many companies at that time, we had to borrow heavily to survive.

definitions.definition: to take and use a word or idea from another language or piece of work:
examples: English has borrowed many words from French.
